channel.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: Microsoft cuts jobs in Xbox division, cancels games
item.description: Microsoft's gaming division initiated significant layoffs. Hundreds of employees faced job cuts. King, the maker of Candy Crush, saw a 10% staff reduction. Call of Duty maker Raven Software also announced workforce reductions. Microsoft cancelled several long-term projects. These included the fantasy game Everwild. An original online game from ZeniMax Online Studios was also cancelled.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs acquitted of sex trafficking but found guilty on lesser charges
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs was acquitted of racketeering and sex trafficking charges in a New York trial, but convicted on two counts of transportation for prostitution. The jury's decision followed seven weeks of testimony detailing allegations of abuse and coercive sex.

item.title: Outcry in Baloch over killing of activist after forced disappearance
item.description: Outrage has exploded in Pakistan's Balochistan after the killing of activist Zeeshan Ahmed, allegedly by military personnel. Zeeshan, who sought the return of his forcibly disappeared father, was abducted on June 29th and his body was discovered the next day. The Baloch Yakjehti Committee reports Zeeshan's body showed signs of torture, including bullet wounds.
item.dc:creator: Raj Shekhar Jha

item.title: Hamas poring over Trump's truce proposal
item.description: Hamas is currently reviewing a proposed 60-day ceasefire for Gaza, which US President Trump has declared as 'final,' following Israel's agreement to the terms. Hamas aims for a deal ensuring the war's end and Israeli withdrawal. Meanwhile, Israeli PM Netanyahu reiterated his call for Hamas's elimination.

item.title: Vietnam agrees to minimum 20% tariff; US goes duty-free
item.description: President Trump has announced a trade deal with Vietnam, eliminating duties on US goods entering the country while imposing a 20% levy on Vietnamese exports to the US. Vietnam confirmed an agreement to address reciprocal tariffs, with the US potentially reducing taxes on Vietnamese exports. The US also plans a 40% tax on goods transshipped through Vietnam.

item.title: Sean Diddy denied bail; convicted of prostitution charges; acquitted of sex trafficking, racketeering
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs was denied bail after being convicted on federal prostitution charges, despite acquittal on sex trafficking and racketeering allegations. Judge Arun Subramanian cited the seriousness of the evidence and a pattern of violence as reasons for keeping Combs in custody. The defense argued against detention, but the prosecution emphasized Combs' wealth, violence, and disregard for the law.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US: Skydiving plane with 15 aboard crashes in New Jersey; at least 5 hospitalised
Tragedy in Oman: School bus crash kills driver and three students, leaves twelve injured
item.description: A tragic school bus accident in Izki, Oman, killed four, including three children, and injured twelve others on Wednesday morning. The bus collided with a lamppost, overturned, and caught fire. Emergency services responded quickly, with injured children treated at Izki and Nizwa hospitals. Authorities are investigating the cause, while the incident raises serious concerns about school transportation safety in Oman.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UAE: Long-awaited unified GCC tourism visa coming soon, confirms GCC Secretary General
item.description: GCC Secretary General Jassem Al Budaiwi announced that the long-awaited unified tourism visa is set to be introduced soon. Approved in November 2023, the visa will allow travelers to visit all six member states with a single application, aiming to simplify travel, boost tourism, enhance security, and support economic diversification beyond oil.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Going nowhere': UK PM Starmer backs Rachel Reeves as chancellor; Badenoch slams budget U-turn
item.description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves's future is uncertain after PM Starmer dodged questions about her staying until the next election, leading to market instability. Reeves appeared distressed during PMQs, where Badenoch criticized the government's welfare reform U-turn and its impact on Reeves's budget. Downing Street insists Reeves has full support despite speculation and a "personal matter."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK shuts both its Afghan resettlement schemes without warning
item.description: In a controversial move, the UK government has abruptly ended two schemes that provided sanctuary to over 34,000 Afghans, sparking outrage. The closure affects the Afghan Relocations and Assistance Policy (ARAP) and the Afghan Citizens Resettlement Scheme (ACRS). Critics, like Dr. Nooralhaq Nasimi, condemn the decision as discriminatory, highlighting the plight of vulnerable Afghans still in danger.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: NYC port authority accident: 12 injured in bus terminal crash; lane ramp reopens after traffic delays
item.description: A three-bus collision at New York City's Port Authority Bus Terminal during the morning rush hour injured at least twelve people, causing significant traffic disruptions. The incident, involving New Jersey Transit buses on the fourth-level entrance ramp, led to temporary service suspensions and ramp closures. Authorities are investigating the cause, with a possible medical emergency for one driver being considered.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tourists in the Gulf no longer flock to malls and beaches, says report: Where are they going now?
item.description: Gulf travellers from the UAE, Qatar, and Saudi Arabia are shifting from shopping and leisure toward culturally rich, purpose-driven experiences, according to a PwC–Mabrian report. With rising demand for flexible stays and emotional connection, tourism leaders are urged to rethink destination planning, embrace integrated experiences, and foster public-private collaboration to meet the evolving expectations of modern visitors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 19th century law fails: Wisconsin supreme court overturns 176-year old abortion ban; pro-choice advocates cheer
item.description: The Wisconsin supreme court has reversed the state's 1849 abortion ban. The court decided that a more recent law takes precedence. This law criminalizes abortions only when the fetus is viable outside the womb. The ruling concludes a three-year legal battle. It reaffirms that current laws focused on fetal viability are now in effect.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: GOP leaders rally for last-ditch push: Holdouts meet Donald Trump amid deep divisions; vote expected soon
item.description: With the deadline looming, House Republican leaders and White House officials are making a concerted effort to pass the GOP bill. Speaker Mike Johnson is actively engaging with concerned Republican factions, while some members are meeting with Trump. Despite the push, some GOP members remain cautious, reviewing the 887-page bill.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: IBAN rules for local and international transfers in Oman have changed: What you need to know
item.description: Starting July 1, 2025, Oman will require IBANs for all domestic bank transfers, following earlier implementation for international transfers in March 2024. The Central Bank of Oman says the move boosts accuracy and speed. Banks like Emirates NBD are urging users to update beneficiary details to avoid failed payments. International transfers to Oman no longer require IBANs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Best time to buy home in Dubai? Govt launches exclusive incentives for 1st time resident buyers
item.description: Dubai has launched a first-of-its-kind programme offering exclusive incentives to UAE residents buying property for the first time. Backed by top developers and banks, the scheme includes priority access, flexible mortgages, and interest-free fees. Aimed at boosting real estate investment and long-term residency, the initiative aligns with Dubai’s D33 strategy and 2040 population growth goals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy trial verdict: Rapper convicted on prostitution charges; cleared on sex trafficking counts
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs faced a mixed verdict, acquitted of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking involving Cassie Ventura and "Jane." However, he was found guilty of transporting them and others across state lines for prostitution. The trial centered on allegations of Combs using his influence to coerce women into abusive situations, with testimony from Ventura and "Jane" detailing threats and assaults.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Explained: Why Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs was acquitted of sex trafficking charges but found guilty of prostitution charges
item.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs was found guilty on two federal counts of transporting women for prostitution, but acquitted of sex-trafficking and racketeering conspiracy charges. The verdict, delivered in New York, stunned the entertainment industry. Combs faces up to 20 years in prison.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dalai Lama defies China: Reincarnation will be Tibetan-led; what it means for Xi Jinping
item.description: The Dalai Lama has affirmed his reincarnation will continue, challenging China's claim to approve his successor. This declaration, made before his 90th birthday, intensifies the geopolitical struggle over Tibetan autonomy and religious freedom. The Dalai Lama's stance protects Tibetan Buddhism from Chinese manipulation, while China aims to control the reincarnation for political dominance.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk
